locale.message: When an author, copyeditor or editor uploads a new version (odt, doc, docx, or pdf format) of an article, this module submits it to the document markup server specified in the configuration file, and receives a zipped file containing pdf, xml, and html versions of the article, as well as bibliography information automatically styled per the journal's guidelines. This zipped file is kept in the supplementary files folder for inspection during the review process. When ready to publish the article, the pdf, xml, and html galley files are extracted and made available from the journal table of contents.
Unable to fetch article xml and html versions. The Document Markup plugin needs to be enabled and the citation style needs to be provided in Journal Settings.
Type part of an organization or publication name to lookup the citation style from the local CSL database. Our database is updated regularly from its http://citationstyles.org/styles/ source.
The journal will retrieve converted documents from this server URL. Normally you should not change this setting.

This plugin can use either a guest account (limited to 10 conversions per week) or an unlimited use account. Leave the user id and password fields blank for guest account use. For more information, visit PKP Document Markup Service.
Select this if you want a separate document-review.pdf version prepared for reviewers. It is stripped of author information and is available in the "Document Markup Files" supplementary file archive.
PHP Curl needs to be installed on your OJS server. This plugin uses curl to send and receive the article files to the [pdfx] web server service for processing.
PHP zlib needs to be installed on your OJS server. This plugin uses zlib to unzip the Document Markup Server files.
